title: I just got a job in my field earning 60k at 22. I'm on track to have 50m in my 401k at 65
body:
And that's if I never got a pay increase 

60k income, 15% goes in my 401k pre tax  and employer matches 6% -> 21% of my yearly income = $1,050 a month invested

Most aggressive indexes out there as I am not planning on touching this money for 43 years -> 15% yearly return expected

If I never changed anything and never looked at this account, it would be valued at 51m in 43 years when I retire at 65

But yea, it's definitely hard to make money and get rich in America
